text:
Hello,
I want to add custom text field in HubSpot call activity to log some call information.
Is it possible through any API that HubSpot has for this?

Hello, everyone!

I found a very unpleasant bug related to deal and company associations.

According to the ERD table one deal is associated with one company. But if you use the API to bind a company to a deal, you can bind many companies to one deal.

In Association Api there will be this set, in the interface the latest.

Who is right? The interface or the API?

<https://lucid.app/documents/embeddedchart/ea90eecf-e825-4476-b918-d8f6ddb53a81#>
Hi Does anyone know how to the get all the company with contract belong to the company just by API?
What I am trying is to have know how many contracts in a company, and pull all the contracts' information.

Hello all!
I have a question regarding the use of the HubSpot api to pull contact data. As a little background information we use Airbyte as the ETL tool (previously we were using Stitch) to transfer data to our redshift instance. It has been working very well for over a month now, but between Thursday (9/9) and Friday (9/10) of last week something changed and we began getting ‘414 Request-URI Too Large for url’ errors. One of my team members said they only added 4 new columns to the contacts properties table but I have no idea if I can verify if that was the only thing that changed. I have spoken with an Airbyte developer directly and done my own research which has made me aware that this is a known error that can come up.
Airbyte does not allow me to select specific properties from the contacts table, it just tries to pull everything it sees which is (as of right now) 554 properties. Does this seem like an abnormally large number of properties to be handled by the api?
Anyone have a clue to get more than default properties by API?
for example the company api only return `name`, `domain`, `createdate`, `hs_lastmodifieddate`, `hs_object_id`
how about I want more such as address, phone...?

Hey <@U02BPQZ89QE>,

You can try by adding comma separated HS properties internal name in Request URL with 'properties' parameter:

?properties=prop_internalname1,prop_internalname2, property_internalname3,....
ok, I will try it. Thank you very much <@U01PJMZ5KPH>
<@U01PJMZ5KPH> It works as expected. You are the man! Thank you very much.
